H0.text: Precipitation is the form in which rain, snow, or sleet falls to the ground in the water cycle.

H1.text: Condensation is the process in the water cycle where rain, snow, or sleet falls to the ground.

H2.text: Evaporation is a form of rain, snow, or sleet falling to the ground in the water cycle.

H3.text: Transpiration is the form of precipitation—rain, snow, or sleet—that falls to the ground in the water cycle.

A4.text: Precipitation occurs when a portion of the atmosphere becomes saturated with water vapor (reaching 100% relative humidity), so that the water condenses and 'precipitates' or falls.

A5.text: Transpiration from plants is one of the main ways water vapor is added to the air.
